data.prayer: Jesus, help the local leaders in Al Isma‘iliyah, Egypt not be proud but humble, and willing to wash the feet of all they serve.
data.verse: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am. Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another’s feet. I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Al Isma‘iliyah, Egypt
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Lord of the Harvest, please send out workers into the the state of Al Isma‘iliyah, Egypt.
data.verse: Then he said to his disciples, “The harvest is plentiful but the workers are few. Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

data.prayer: Lord, use Google search to lead people in Al Isma‘iliyah, Egypt to the gospel today.
Father, you gave the church of Al Isma‘iliyah, Egypt the greatest shepherd of all time, Jesus. Please, help them listen to him.
data.verse: I will place over them one shepherd, my servant David, and he will tend them; he will tend them and be their shepherd.

data.prayer: Lord God, I thank you that the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without defect to God, can cleanse the Fur people conscience from dead works to serve the living God.
Please, convict the 38,400 believers in Al Isma‘iliyah, Egypt to look to you as their only hope for strength and fruitfulness and life.
data.verse: "I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.

data.prayer: Spirit, renew the call of John the Baptist in the state of Al Isma`iliyah. Send out bold servants who will call all to repent.
data.verse: Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

data.prayer: Father, remind your church in Al Isma‘iliyah, Egypt that you have set your Son over all rule and authority, power and dominion, and every name that is invoked.
data.verse: he raised Christ from the dead and seated him at his right hand in the heavenly realms, far above all rule and authority, power and dominion, and every name that is invoked, not only in the present age but also in the one to come.
